Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Interface IAbilityContinuation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AceAbility

    public interface IAbilityContinuation
    Enables an Ability to implement migration in a distributed system.

    You can use the migration capability provided by the Ability to migrate data between a local device and a remote device in a distributed system. The ability or ability slice that implements this interface has the migration capability. You can initiate a migration request by calling Ability#continueAbility() or AbilitySlice#continueAbility() on the local device, and then implement the methods provided in this interface to save or restore application data. The saved data is managed by the distributed data management module. The remote device can obtain and restore the saved data when starting the ability. In this way, the ability on the local device is migrated to the remote device.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int ERR_ABILITY_QUERY_FAILED
      Indicates that the HAP package of the application cannot be found.
      static int ERR_CONTINUE_TIMEOUT
      Indicates that the migration times out.
      static int ERR_DEVICE_OFFLINE
      Indicates that the device goes offline during the migration.
      static int ERR_INSTALL_FREE_NOT_SUPPORTED
      Indicates that the ability to be migrated does not support the installation-free feature.
      static int ERR_NETWORK_UNAVAILABLE
      Indicates that the network of the peer device is unavailable.

      Indicates that the parameter verification fails.

      Indicates that the permission verification fails.
      static int ERR_REMOTE_DEVICE_INCOMPATIBLE
      Indicates that the OS version of the peer device is incompatible.
      static int ERR_UNKNOWN
      Indicates that the migration fails.
      static int SUCCESS
      Indicates that the migration is successful.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onCompleteContinuation​(int result)
      Called back when a local ability migration is complete.
      default void onFailedContinuation​(int errorCode)
      Called when an error occurred during the migration process of a local ability.
      default void onRemoteTerminated​()
      Called to notify the local device when a running ability on the remote device is destroyed after a reversible migration is performed for the ability from the local device to the remote device.
      boolean onRestoreData​(IntentParams restoreData)
      Restores the user data saved during the migration for an ability on the remote device immediately after the ability is created on the remote device.
      boolean onSaveData​(IntentParams saveData)
      Saves the user data (carried in the IntentParams object) of a local ability generated during runtime.
      boolean onStartContinuation​()
      Asks a user whether to start the migration.

    • Field Detail

      • ERR_ABILITY_QUERY_FAILED

        static final int ERR_ABILITY_QUERY_FAILED
        Indicates that the HAP package of the application cannot be found.

        This constant is an error code returned to the application via onFailedContinuation(int) when an error occurred during the ability migration process.

        Since:
        6
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERR_CONTINUE_TIMEOUT

        static final int ERR_CONTINUE_TIMEOUT
        Indicates that the migration times out. The timeout duration is 50 seconds.

        This constant is an error code returned to the application via onFailedContinuation(int) when an error occurred during the ability migration process.

        Since:
        6
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Since:

    • Method Detail

      • onStartContinuation

        boolean onStartContinuation​()
        Asks a user whether to start the migration.

        This method is called back when a local ability initiates a migration request.

        If the Ability does not implement this method, this Ability cannot be migrated, and false is returned. If the AbilitySlice does not implement this method, it does not affect whether its host ability can be migrated, and true is returned by default.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the user allows the migration; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • onSaveData

        boolean onSaveData​(IntentParams saveData)
        Saves the user data (carried in the IntentParams object) of a local ability generated during runtime. After the migration is triggered and the local ability is ready, this method is called when the Distributed Scheduler Service requests data from the local ability.
        Parameters:
        saveData - Indicates the user data to save.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is successfully saved; returns false otherwise.

      • onRestoreData

        boolean onRestoreData​(IntentParams restoreData)
        Restores the user data saved during the migration for an ability on the remote device immediately after the ability is created on the remote device. Lifecycle scheduling for the ability starts only after the user data is restored.
        Parameters:
        restoreData - Indicates the user data to restore.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is successfully restored; returns false otherwise.

      • onCompleteContinuation

        void onCompleteContinuation​(int result)
        Called back when a local ability migration is complete.

        You can define the processing logic after the migration is complete. For example, you can display a prompt to notify the user of the successful migration and then exit the local ability.

        Parameters:
        result - Indicates the migration result code. The value 0 indicates that the migration is successful, and -1 indicates that the migration fails.
        Since:
        1

      • onRemoteTerminated

        default void onRemoteTerminated​()
        Called to notify the local device when a running ability on the remote device is destroyed after a reversible migration is performed for the ability from the local device to the remote device. A reversible migration is triggered by calling Ability#continueAbilityReversibly() or Ability#continueAbilityReversibly(String).
        Since:
        3

      • onFailedContinuation

        default void onFailedContinuation​(int errorCode)
        Called when an error occurred during the migration process of a local ability.

        You can define the processing logic upon a migration error. For example, you can display a prompt message indicating that the network of the peer device is unavailable.

        Parameters:
        errorCode - Indicates the migration error code, which is defined in this interface.
        Since:
        6
